author: ericav.knowles
title: NFT platform for art organizations
description: Traditional art buyers & orgs. (museums/ galleries) don't have enough guidance to utilize NFT marketplaces leaving valuable art & buyers out

assessments.note: Sounds like a great project. Curation is definitely something the NFT space needs. I like how art organisations and the artist will get paid through smart contracts when pieces are sold on the secondary market. I wonder how we can bring more traditional artists to the NFT space. Very few of my favourite artists have released NFTs. I also like how you broaden the scope to paintings, music and photography. Could universities art departments be included? And what about private art owners? Could they make NFTs of the original artworks that they own?
NFT marketplace with the features listed in the proposal is the need of the day. There is also a sustainable business model in the proposal.

There is an abundance of NFT related proposals on Catalyst.  Initial NFT sales on Cardano show the need for more organized NFT platforms.  The proposal aims to bring artists and galleries into the Cardano ecosystem.  I think their focused, small scale, city by city approach has a good chance of success and could onboard many users and transactions.

The proposers have experience and have put together a detailed plan outlining competitors and risks. As they state it is a crowded market place, thus this is a key risk. How do they standout. They have thought about this however which is the first step.

The proposals claim a combined experience of 40 years. However, no reference to work done in the past has been provided, even after a comment from a community member. Google search of the name given in the proposal also did not reveal any related profile.

The proposal could be better organized but the team members do seem to have relevant blockchain experience and connections to local art worlds. It would be nice if this experience was verifiable or more fully detailed. After seeing so many NFT proposals, I was skeptical, but on closer reading I feel that this proposal has a good plan and ability to carve out a unique niche in the marketplace.

Very detailed proposal. Maybe needs to be condensed a little, as it's quite a long read. The market opportunity section doesn't read very well. One of your links to the questionnaire didn't work as there's an asterisk placed at the end which needs deleting.

The proposal is exhaustive in providing details of features with design documents. It also claims to be finalizing of MOU with initial art museum cohorts. The progress is in the development of the website and the backend office. The steps are fairly auditable. The code is written may or may not be open source since no clarity has been provided in the proposal.

Development of the platform is easily auditable. Fund allocation is broken down, and a development timeline is provided. It should be possible to judge the success of the platform development within 6 months. Little guidance is given as to what success looks like as far as adoption and number of transactions.  These are the metrics which most impact the relevant challenge goals.

solution: We're building a NFT platform & marketplace that attracts new users & organizations to Cardano by providing art curated by art organizations
experience: Our Sales Dir. has held art events & successfully launched new products. Our teams have 40+ years of tech & management consulting experience
